tests.name: CSS
tests.run: ORIG_HASH=6f0a9d21938c642724d9ab864490393e; ORIG_SIZE=1782; HASH=$(cat public/style.css | md5sum | tr -dc '0-9a-f'); SIZE=$(du -ba ./public/style.css | tr -dc '0-9') && [[ "$SIZE" -gt "$ORIG_SIZE" && "$HASH" != "ORIG_HASH" ]] && echo "PASS"

tests.name: HTML
tests.run: ORIG_HASH=4778984198ab9d52e284aee502ba48b1; ORIG_SIZE=1632; HASH=$(cat public/index.html | md5sum | tr -dc '0-9a-f'); SIZE=$(du -ba ./public/index.html | tr -dc '0-9') && [[ "$SIZE" -gt "$ORIG_SIZE" && "$HASH" != "ORIG_HASH" ]] && echo "PASS"

tests.name: Get more 12500 points for Valid CSS
CSS validator help
tests.run: printf -- "If your CSS is not validating, run it through the w3c CSS validator and  figure it out:\n https://jigsaw.w3.org/css-validator/\n"

tests.name: Get 12500 more points for valid HTML
HTML validator help
tests.run: printf -- "If your HTML is not validating, run it through the w3c markup validator and  figure it out:\n https://validator.w3.org/#validate_by_input\n"

tests.name: HTML and CSS validator documentation
tests.run:
printf -- "The autograder is using two Node packages to do the above validation.
To un derstand their output, look at the documentation:
 https://www.npmjs.com/package/html-validate
 https://www.npmjs.com/package/css-validator
Figure it out.
"
